citation.article-title: Thermotoga neapolitana sp. nov. of the extremely thermophilic, eubacterial genus Thermotoga.

p.s: Description of Thermotoga neapolitana, Jannasch, Huber, Belkin and Stetter, sp. nov.
Thermotoga neapolitana (ne.a.po.li.ta'na M. L. fem. adj. neapolitana, having been isolated near Naples)
Cells are Gram-negative rods, occurring singly and in pairs, about 1.5 to 11 μm long and 0.6 μm in width, surrounded by a sheath-like outer structure, usually ballooning over the ends.
Cells become coccoid in stationary phase.
Growth up to 90°C with an optimum near 80°C (45 min doubling time).
No growth below 55°C pH of growth between 5.5 and 9 with an optimum at around 7.
The DNA base composition is about 41 mol% G+C.
The DNA homology with Thermotoga maritima DSM 3109 is about 24%.
Single strain isolated from shallow submarine hot springs near Lucrino, Bay of Naples, Italy.
Type strain is Thermotoga neapolitana, NS-E, DSM 43 59, Göttingen, FRG.
